name: fin10

procedures: T1021.001::[FIN10] has used RDP to move laterally to systems in the victim environment.
T1033::[FIN10] has used Meterpreter to enumerate users on remote systems.
T1053.005::[FIN10] has established persistence by using S4U tasks as well as the Scheduled Task option in PowerShell Empire.
T1059.001::[FIN10] uses PowerShell for execution as well as PowerShell Empire to establish persistence.
T1059.003::[FIN10] has executed malicious .bat files containing PowerShell commands.
T1070.004::[FIN10] has used batch scripts and scheduled tasks to delete critical system files.
T1078.003::[FIN10] has moved laterally using the Local Administrator account.
T1078::[FIN10] has used stolen credentials to connect remotely to victim networks using VPNs protected with only a single factor.
T1547.001::[FIN10] has established persistence by using the Registry option in PowerShell Empire to add a Run key.
T1570::[FIN10] has deployed Meterpreter stagers and SplinterRAT instances in the victim network after moving laterally.
T1588.002::[FIN10] has relied on publicly-available software to gain footholds and establish persistence in victim environments.

description: [FIN10](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0051) is a financially motivated threat group that has targeted organizations in North America since at least 2013 through 2016. The group uses stolen data exfiltrated from victims to extort organizations. (Citation: FireEye FIN10 June 2017)
